data.question: What is the primary application of lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks as mentioned in the text?
What method is used for the synthesis of Eu(m-pbc)?
True or False: The emission intensities of dimetallic compounds decrease after incorporation of Y(III) ions.
What is the effect of sonication-assisted solution exfoliation on the nanosheets?
data.answer: It helps in obtaining nanosheets with lateral dimensions from nano- to micro-meter scales and thicknesses down to several layers.

data.question: True or False: The nanosheets obtained from lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks can only be used for fingerprint imaging on glass surfaces.
What is the role of the m-pbc ligand in the photoluminescence studies?
data.answer: It acts as an efficient antenna toward Eu and Tb(III) ions.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of Tb(m-pbc) and Gd(m-pbc) follows a different procedure than that of Eu(m-pbc).
What is the significance of the pendent uncoordinated carboxylic groups in the lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks?
data.answer: They benefit the labeling of fingerprints by reacting with fingerprint residues, showing efficient imaging on all kinds of material surfaces.

data.question: True or False: The luminescence properties of Ln(m-pbc)s are not affected by the incorporation of Y(III) ions.
What is the outcome of the amino coupling reaction confirmed by FT-IR spectra?
data.answer: It confirms the bonding activity of the exposed carboxylate groups to potential bio-samples.

data.question: True or False: The nanosheets of lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks are not stable and cannot preserve fingerprints for long periods.
What is the main structural feature of the lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks?
data.answer: They are neutral polymeric 2D layered structures with pendent uncoordinated carboxylic groups between layers.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of YxEu1−x(m-pbc) and YxTb1−x(m-pbc) involves replacing all Eu(NO3)3·6H2O/Tb(NO3)3·6H2O with Y(NO3)3·6H2O.
What is the effect of dilution with Y(III) ions on the emission intensities of dimetallic compounds?
data.answer: The emission intensities of dimetallic compounds are clearly enhanced after incorporation of Y(III) ions due to the dilution effect.

data.question: True or False: The nanosheets derived from lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks can be aged for almost a year without losing their ability to detect fingerprints.
What is the role of sonication in the preparation of nanosheets?
data.answer: Sonication assists in the exfoliation of bulk crystals into nanosheets.

data.question: True or False: The phosphonocarboxylic ligand cannot act as an antenna for efficient sensitization of lanthanide-ion luminescence.
What is the main advantage of using 2-D MOFs with in situ accommodating accessible functional groups for latent fingerprint imaging?
data.answer: They have the advantage of in situ accommodating accessible functional groups between layers, which is beneficial for latent fingerprint imaging.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of lanthanide phosphonocarboxylate frameworks does not involve a hydrothermal method.
What is the significance of the thermal stability study of Eu(m-pbc)?
data.answer: It demonstrates the remarkable crystalline-phase stability of Eu(m-pbc).
